NEW DELHI: With the future of the Indian Super League (ISL) looking uncertain, TOI has learnt from sources that the sports ministry has ruled out using govt funds to support the All India Football Federation (AIFF), club owners and other stakeholders in running the ISL. Although the ministry has assured that the ISL and the second-tier I-League will take place this season, it could not draw on its annual budgetary allocation for that purpose. “The ministry can't help in funding and running of the league. That has to be done by the stakeholders involved,” a source informed.The ministry has suggested that ISL clubs should fund the interim expenses themselves until a new sponsorship deal is struck. This would allow the league to begin at the earliest. Once a suitable new commercial sponsor comes on board or the existing agreement with Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL) is reworked, the amount spent could be adjusted against the sponsorship revenue.It also recommended that clubs limit the number of venues and explore conducting the league in fewer cities to cut operational and logistical costs. The ISL usually kicks off in Sept every season but, as yet, the competition has not started. The Supreme Court (SC) is all set to hold a crucial hearing on Tuesday to resolve the commercial rights impasse concerning the future of the ISL. The agenda of the hearing is to discuss a pathway for the commercial aspects of the league, as the existing Master Rights Agreement between AIFF and its commercial partner FSDL expired on Monday (Dec 8).It's been learnt that the ministry submitted a status report to the apex court on Monday.
Article Summary: The sports ministry has ruled out using govt funds to support the All India Football Federation (AIFF), club owners and other stakeholders in running the ISL. Joe Burrow reflects on the mental toll of multiple injuries in 2024

This week, Joe Burrow ’s press conference hit differently, and you could feel it in the room. But when he faced the cameras before the Ravens game, his thoughts moved away from medical timelines. As the Bengals aim to steer clear of another postseason-less year, Burrow’s candidness might be the best indicator of his mindset as he reenters the lineup.Burrow was open about the total impact of his injuries when asked. "I think I’ve been through more than most," he told reporters during the December 11, 2024, press conference at Paycor Stadium."Certainly not easy on the brain or the body, so just trying to have fun doing it again."The admission was made after an ESPN reporter followed up, asking about the mental hurdles of going through multiple recoveries. Burrow went into detail, recognizing the impact but not getting into specifics, "I have been through a lot. If it’s not fun, then what am I doing it for?" He added, "It doesn’t change my desire to win,".When another reporter from NFL Network asked if it was tough to find joy again considering his past, Burrow answered simply, "It’s certainly." He pointed out that the shift came from ongoing career contemplation rather than a single lightbulb moment, emphasizing that it was more of a gradual awareness than a pinpointed event.Burrow's candor extended to broader pressures. Asked about external factors influencing his mindset, he said, "There are just a lot of things going on right now. A lot of things going on." Clarifying to a Cincinnati Enquirer reporter whether these were football-related or personal, he stated simply, "All of the above."These quotes indicated a shift from Burrow's normal brevity. They portrayed a 29-year-old star grappling with not only physical pain, turf toe swelling that extended into practices but also the mental weariness of uncertainty. "If I want to keep doing this, I have to have fun doing it," he reiterated, a line that resonated as a quiet manifesto for sustainability.Joe Burrow’s straightforwardness provided a rare insight into a star aiming to reconnect with the game on his own terms. Her reflection wasn’t bitter, only deeply honest about love, growth, and the courage to start over.At a time when rumors swirled that Brady’s football career, and his refusal to retire, led to the breakup, Bündchen firmly dismissed that narrative. She called the allegations “very hurtful” and “the craziest thing I’ve ever heard,” explaining that she had actually always been one of his biggest supporters.“Listen, I have always cheered for him, and I would continue forever… If there's one person I want to be the happiest in the world, it's him,” she said, emphasizing that she still wanted Brady to succeed long after their marriage ended.Instead, Bündchen said the divorce came not from conflict, but from growth. “Sometimes you grow together; sometimes you grow apart,” she explained, reflecting on how their dreams changed over time. What they wanted as a young couple didn’t fully align with who they eventually became. “That doesn't mean you don't love the person. It just means that… you have to have somebody who can meet you in the middle, right? It's a dance. It's a balance.”Today, the two remain committed to raising their children in a supportive, modern family structure, with both living in Miami and co-parenting with mutual respect. Bündchen returned to modeling and embraced life in Costa Rica, and Brady moved on from his playing career. She summed up their evolution with rare maturity: “We’re not playing against each other. We are a team, and that’s beautiful.”Also Read: “You make every room brighter”: Gisele Bündchen makes rare appearance in Tom Brady’s heartfelt Instagram post
Article Summary: Gisele Bündchen spoke out about her divorce from Tom Brady in an interview with Vanity Fair. She described the split as a "death and a rebirth," emphasizing that their split stemmed from growing apart, not conflict. The couple now co- parents their children respectfully.

Article Title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union sends touching tribute to A’ja Wilson after her inspiring accolade: “Without scandal or gimmicks”
Article Text:
Gabrielle Union and A’ja Wilson. Image via: Arturo Holmes/ Getty Images | Juan Ocampo/NBAE via Getty Images

Dwyane Wade ’s wife Gabrielle Union sends emotional shoutout to A’ja Wilson for her outstanding WNBA contributions



A’ja Wilson secures AP Female Athlete of the Year



The name of A’ja Wilson has turned into a synonym of excellence, strength, and inspiration. This week she was showered in praise by Gabrielle Union who termed Wilson a culture shifter and her capacity to make an impact without being controversial. Union shared that Wilson makes the world open its eyes, no scandal, no gimmicks. This applause shows the impact that Wilson has had on the basketball field as well as serving as an example to both young players and fans. Her profession is a depiction of persistence, talent and personality.The accolades keep piling up for Wilson, whose season with the Las Vegas Aces has been nothing short of extraordinary. On top of her athletic feats, the four-time WNBA MVP has inspired a new generation of female athletes. Even LeBron James reflected on her broader influence, noting, “I realized her greatest impact isn’t what I see, it’s what Zhuri sees. A’ja Wilson is the definition of female Black excellence, and I am so grateful she is giving my daughter the kind of inspiration I got from Michael Jordan and Ken Griffey Jr. ”NBA legend Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union told Time that A’ja Wilson “a culture shifter.” “She forces the world to take notice without scandal or gimmicks, just excellence without trying to be perfect,” Union added.Wilson’s 2025 season further established her legacy. She led the Aces to a third championship in four seasons while claiming her fourth MVP, third Defensive Player of the Year, and second Finals MVP.Coach Becky Hammon shared Wilson’s unique blend of talent and humility, saying, “Her relatability, her being down to earth makes her a great superstar. Her skill set is unmatched, but she’s also the easiest player to coach. To have that mixture of humility, grace and skill, there’s a reason why she’s doing things that have never been done.” Wilson overcame adversity, rallying her team from a .500 record to a 16-game winning streak, ultimately sweeping Phoenix in the WNBA Finals.Wilson’s excellence has been recognized beyond the WNBA. She was named TIME’s 2025 Athlete of the Year and The Associated Press Female Athlete of the Year, making her only the fifth basketball player to earn the honor since 1931.Reflecting on the recognition, Wilson said, “It’s an honor when you think about the group of women who have won before. Just to have my name be a part of it, I’m blessed.” Wilson also has cultural influence and in business ventures, including a successful shoe and clothing line with Nike, demonstrating that Wilson’s impact transcends basketball.Also Read: Hollywood actress receives touching compliment from Magic Johnson after posing for a photo at star-studded event
Article Summary: A’ja Wilson was named TIME’s 2025 Athlete of the Year and The Associated Press Female athlete of the year. She led the Las Vegas Aces to a third championship in four seasons while claiming her fourth MVP, third Defensive Player of Year, and second Finals MVP. NBA legend Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union called Wilson a culture shifter.

Rumors around Giannis Antetokounmpo’s future have intensified again, and the Miami Heat sit front and center in the speculation. With Milwaukee stumbling to a 10-15 start and the two-time MVP recently discussing his calf injury situation with the Bucks’ front office, league insiders continue to float the possibility of a franchise-altering move if the team cannot rebound. Miami, sitting at 14-11 and searching for a new offensive engine, has emerged as one of the most aggressive theoretical suitors.Tyler Herro, Miami’s 2025 All-Star guard averaging 23.8 points per game, has become the headline name in potential packages. His $31 million salary and on-ball scoring make him the most realistic matching asset in any scenario involving Antetokounmpo.A hypothetical trade framework circulating among insiders outlines how a blockbuster could be structured. Miami would receive Giannis Antetokounmpo (31, extension-eligible at $175 million), Gary Trent Jr., Andre Jackson Jr., and Thanasis Antetokounmpo.Milwaukee Bucks, in turn, would gain a combination of young talent, expiring salary, and long-term draft control: Tyler Herro, Kel’el Ware, Jaime Jaquez Jr., Terry Rozier, two first-round picks (2030 and 2032), and a 2031 pick swap. Trade machine projections show the salaries balancing without forcing Miami to include Bam Adebayo.• Adds a generational force to pair with Bam Adebayo• Immediately elevates its ceiling, especially without Jimmy Butler’s usual playoff presence• Maintains defensive structure by keeping Adebayo• Fits Antetokounmpo’s preference for disciplined, competitive environments like Pat Riley’s culture• Positions Miami as a top-three seed in the East• Acquires Herro as a 25-year-old efficient scorer to reset the backcourt• Adds Kel’el Ware, one of the most promising rookie bigs• Gains two first-round picks and an additional swap to reshape a roster that has slipped to 11th in the East• Begins a post-Damian Lillard rebuild with real foundational pieces• Avoids losing Giannis for limited value at a later date• Miami sacrifices Herro’s shot creation and Ware’s long-term upside• Milwaukee faces immediate fan backlash for parting with a Finals MVP• Heat lose future flexibility with multiple picks outgoing• Bucks take on short-term competitive decline during the resetIf completed, this deal would instantly shift the balance of power. The Heat would deploy a Giannis-Bam frontcourt that rivals any defensive tandem in the league, while Antetokounmpo’s 28.9 points, 10.8 rebounds, and 6.8 assists this season make him the exact offensive presence Miami has lacked.Milwaukee, meanwhile, gets a workable overhaul. Herro’s 23.8 points per game and 52.4 percent shooting offer a fresh scoring identity, while Ware and Jaquez add developmental depth. With draft assets added, the Bucks have multiple paths to rebuild quickly or pivot again at future deadlines.• Elevates roster from fringe contender to immediate title threat• Giannis transforms offensive efficiency and defensive versatility• Seamless pairing next to Adebayo• Fits Miami’s culture and timeline• Depth weakens without Herro and Ware• Limited draft capital moving forward• Pressure skyrockets to win immediately• Gain two foundational young pieces in Herro and Ware• Receive picks needed for a full rebuild• Reset the roster in response to the 11th-place slump• Lose their franchise identity and star power• Potential fan revolt• Short-term competitiveness declines sharplyIf this blockbuster ever materializes, Miami Heat emerge as the clear beneficiary. The Giannis-Bam duo alone positions them at the top of the Eastern Conference hierarchy, while the acquisition fills every gap in their current structure. Milwaukee’s return is logical and strategic, but losing a two-time MVP rarely results in a balanced outcome.Also read: NBA trade rumors: Los Angeles Lakers linked to $68 million New Orleans Pelicans superstar in blockbuster move to pair with Luka Doncic Given the Bucks’ early-season struggles, internal discussions about Giannis’ injury, and prior reports linking Miami to summer offers, the Heat remain one of the few organizations with both the assets and the motivation to make such a seismic move before February’s deadline.
